New Records: Cole Ragans tied a Royals record by striking out eight in a row
Key Match Events: Kyle Isbel led off with an opposite-field single and advanced to second on a Maikel Garcia groundout
Bobby Witt Jr. lined a ball to right that seemed destined to be an RBI single
Ben Gamel made a terrific diving play to make the out
Cole Ragans failed to get an out in the inning and was relieved by Steven Cruz
Stratton pitched a scoreless ninth thanks to a leaping catch by Garrett Hampson in right to rob a Yordan Alvarez home run
The Royals managed to squeak a run across in the top of the seventh
Bobby Witt Jr. belted a home run to left to get his first regulation hit in Texas this year
Pre-Game Insights: The Royals will also have reinforcements tomorrow, hopefully adding Tommy Pham, Robbie Grossman, and Yuli Gurriel will inject some much-needed juice into the Royals’ lineup that has been missing this entire series
Alec Marsh will return to the Royals and make the start. Right-hander Ronel Blanco will go for the Astros. The game will start at 1:10 central time
Post-Match Reflections: The Royals still haven’t won a game in Texas
The Royals still haven’t lost five in a row all year
The Royals are still holding the second Wild Card spot, four games clear of a playoff spot, a game clear of the Twins, and only three games back of the Guardians for the division lead
Their Magic Number shrank again and is now 22
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians, Twins, and Red Sox all lost tonight
The game will start at 1:10 central time
